data.job_description:
About the job Data Analyst Lead

An Analytics Platform Lead is required to lead a team of highly motivated and capable Data Science Operations specialists to advance the platform and processes used to develop, deploy, monitor, track performance and quality, update/maintain Data Science existing and new analytics and data science models.

Working with infrastructure platform team, focus is on advancing automation, testing, quality control, observability and proactive of the Data Science portfolio.

Required Technical Skill Set:

Python/R/SQL, shell scripting, GitHub (version control), Teamcity or other (CI/CD tools), monitoring tools such as Datadog, awareness of cloud computing environments (AWS).

Required Ability to work as part of a distributed and multidisciplinary team and develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Required Assist in the management of sprints and product backlog in an Agile environment.
Required Focus of team is automation, reliability and quality of service for Data Science products.
Desirable Application of advanced analytics, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or optimization algorithms. Understanding of data science fundamentals, methods and techniques.

Desirable Comfortable with analytics and data science project life cycle: scoping, building, testing, implementation, maintenance, tracking and quality assessment of analytics and models.
"

Bonfire isn’t just another digital marketing agency. We deliver results for our valued customers – businesses whom we see as partners, that have a real-world impact on their bottom line.

Our focus and passion for data-driven outcomes have cemented our position as one of Australia’s leading digital performance agencies. Return on investment (ROI) is the foundation of everything we do.

We work with REIWA, Water Corporation, Furniture Bazaar, CurtainWorld, and many more iconic brands.

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our Operations team. This is a hands-on technical role that will suit a self-motivated analytical mind with experience and passion for solving complex multi-faceted problems using data.

Reporting to the General Manager – Business Operations, you will be responsible for working with internal stakeholders to translate complex business questions into abstract analytical models which you will then implement, explore, interpret, and visualise using our best-practise modern data stack.

Most days your role will involve:
• Meeting with members of our leadership team to translate their business intelligence problems into actionable reporting solutions
• Building elegant, modular, extensible data models with Data Build Tool (dbt) using SQL
• Querying our Snowflake data warehouse using SQL to answer ad hoc questions
• Building beautiful dashboards and reports to power insight analysis across all of our internal functions (Operations, Customer Service, Finance etc) using Power BI and ThoughtSpot
• Deep diving into our Snowflake data warehouse to uncover unheralded insights into the performance of our clients digital marketing

Occasionally your role will involve:
• Working directly with clients to resolve interesting questions they might have about their digital marketing data
• Supporting in the development and implementation of data pipeline and automation projects
• Helping educate all Bonfire employees on data-driven analysis and methodologies

You’re likely to have the following qualities:
• You’ve got experience working in similar hands-on analytical roles
• You’ve got formalised training, probably a university degree, in a field relevant to the role at hand, or can make a strong argument why you don’t need one
• You can write complex SQL statements in your sleep
• You may not have had direct experience using Data Built Tool (dbt) but you’ve always wanted to learn
• Data is a hobby and a passion as well as a profession, you’re always using data in your personal life and building personal projects using data
• You can confidently explain what a Google Analytics session is and how marketing attribution works
• You might have worked with Snowflake as a data warehouse, or if not, you’ve definitely worked with similar column-orientated storage like Google BigQuery
• You’re a veracious learner, and revel at the opportunity to learn a new skill or platform
• You celebrate wins, and analyse the opportunities that come from misses
• Though you’re highly analytical, you’re also an excellent communicator and enjoy distilling complex concepts in the clearest, most concise fashion possible

What we can provide you:

We have an excellent office environment located in the heart of Subiaco, and an unparalleled agency culture.

While our way of working is like a well-oiled machine, we have a strong innovation orientation. You will have access to the latest software and programs to hone your craft, and the benefits that come with a collective mindset geared towards continual improvement.

We have strong values (we created them together as a group), we have a talented team with a genuine focus on high performance – and a growing, profitable business with all the benefits that come along with it.

What else can you expect at Bonfire?
• Excellent work-life balance, with a strict ‘no agency hours’ approach, flexible start and finish times and work from home options
• Ongoing training and professional development
• Wellbeing program including an Employee Assistance Program
• Great café-style coffee, cold pressed juices, kombucha, snacks and fresh fruit
• Regular opportunities to socialise and celebrate our success

To get to know us better visit: https://www.bonfire.com.au/work-at-bonfire/.

Interested? Apply via the link with your resume and cover letter. Please note you will be redirected to an external site.

Data Analyst

Are you a Data Analyst who is keen to bridge your technical skills with a passion for Sport? Are you interested in developing your technical skills whilst enabling the next generation of Western Australian Olympians and Paralympians to achieve their goals?

About WAIS

The Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS) is the peak high-performance sporting organisation in Western Australia. WAIS has a proud history of Olympic, Paralympic and World Champions who have accomplished amazing achievements within sport and in life. WAIS enables and supports WA athletes to achieve success on a national and international level. Our culture of Striving for Excellence is lived through the behaviours of athletes and staff that demonstrate Passion, Integrity, Quality and Teamwork.

WAIS is proudly supported by the State Government and is a member of the National Institute Network who collectively support National and State Sporting Organisations to deliver the National High Performance Sport Strategy.

About the role

The Data Analyst supports the delivery of the sports intelligence strategy with skills in scripting, querying and analytics to deliver timely and accurate insight to stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Performance Systems and Analytics (PSA) team which is a newly formed team in the Western Australian Institute of Sport (WAIS). WAIS supports Western Australian athletes perform at the highest levels through providing coaching, training environment and support services (including medical, sports science, coaches, and other service providers. The role of data analyst is key to support the Performance Systems and Analytics team deliver the WAIS sports intelligence strategy.

This position entails a multifaceted scope, affording you the opportunity to acquire and cultivate skills through practical experience. Core duties will include the following:

· Organisation Intelligence: Build and maintain reports, dashboards and intelligence solutions for stakeholders

· Data management: Maintain current and future processes and standards on the data platform

· Data ingestion: Build and maintain sustainable ingestion solutions for new external data sources

· Organisational Data Literacy: Assist in creating organisational data literacy, culture and trust in data solutions

· Communication with stakeholders

The role is based out of the WAIS High Performance Service Centre in the Mt Claremont Sporting Precinct and may require domestic travel.

About you

We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst with proven technical abilities to support the work of the Performance Systems and Analytics Team.

Experience and qualification requirements:

· Experience with SQL, Python and dashboarding tools (Power BI, Tableau etc.)

· Database management

· Ability to translate stakeholder requirements then design and implement relevant solutions

· Data visualisation, reporting and communication

· Familiarity with sports analytics frameworks

· Ability to work with a multidisciplinary team

· Passion for sport and sports performance

Desirable:

· Experience with Fusion/Smartabase

· Experience with Azure

· Data engineering experience

· Power BI experience

Next steps

To apply, you must create an account via our career’s portal and apply https://wais.elmotalent.com.au/careers/default/jobs

Please submit a one-page cover letter along with your resume and experience against the Position Description found on our careers portal.

Applications will close on 4th September 2023, at 5pm AWST.

Please note, shortlisting of candidates will commence prior to this date and applicants are encouraged to apply at your earliest opportunity.

This is a full-time, maximum term contract. The anticipated salary is from $80,570 - $86,797 + superannuation and will be negotiated with the successful candidate.

Please note, only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview.

For further information

For role related queries please contact Kawther Sidhoum, HR Advisor, via email ksidhoum@wais.org.au

Building System Capability

At WAIS, we offer career opportunities for people who share our ambition and passion for high performance sport. From graduates to expert professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as we grow. We would love you to be part of our journey.

Apply today.

data.job_description:
We are looking for a creative Data Analyst to join our diverse team at Ventia in Perth.
Growing your career as a Full Time Data Analyst is a great opportunity to develop competitive skills.
If you are strong in decision-making, teamwork and have the right initiative for the job, then apply for the position of Data Analyst at Ventia today

About the role

Ventia's Defence Base Services (DBS) team are seeking an experiencedData Analystto join their Finance team based in Perth WA.

Due to the diverse nature and geographical spread of our business, we may also consider other candidates who reside in Melbourne, Sydney or Adelaide.
About you

Reporting directly to the (DBS) National Alternate Proposal Governance Manager you are an experienced Data Analyst who can provide practical data & analytics to enable the delivery of long-term sustainable change and improvement across the DBS contract.

This role is integral in providing quantitative and qualitative analytics to help the business produce benefits that lead to strategic outcomes and influence key business decisions.
As a Data Analyst you are responsible for managing the master data, developing reports and troubleshooting data issues. You are adept in translating project requirements into custom-formatted data reports.

The ideal candidate for this position can complete life cycle data generation and outline critical information for each program of work.

Therefore, you are someone with a keen eye for detail and have a thorough understanding of data analysis and visualisation tools and systems.

Key duties, but not limited to:
Technical review and endorsement of Estate Upkeep Alternate Proposals
Build analytics tools that utilise the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer requirements, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics
Assemble large & complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements
Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability
Create data tools for data analytics team and operational managers that assist them in building and optimising our product into an innovative industry leader
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

Skills and experience:
In addition to your formal qualifications and experience, we seek to employ people who possess:
2+ years of experience in a Data Analytics role
Degree qualified in IT, Engineering or Finance
Strong Data visualisation and storytelling skills in both Power BI and Excel
Analytical experience in a Finance division (Management or Financial Accounting Reporting, Balance Sheet Reporting, Reconciliation) or demonstrable understanding of these concepts not essential but would be considered favourably
Ability to source data through data systems and databases (SAP BW, SQL etc). SQL experience advantageous but not essential to this role
In depth understanding of relational database management systems
Strong problem solving and diagnostic skills
Strong business and commercial acumen
An ability to successfully engaging stakeholders from various levels of the business
High level of detail

Other special conditions

The incumbent to this position must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Defence Security Clearance up to a level of negative vetting 1 (secret).
As a result of this requirement the incumbent is preferred to be an Australian Citizen.
This position requires a National Criminal History check and a valid Australian driver's licence.

Benefits

Ventia offers you a flexible, supportive and inclusive work environment where you matter.

In addition, you will find a stimulating and rewarding working environment where we take our peoples careers seriously and help them to learn and grow.

This role comes with the added security of being offered as a permanent position with consideration of future flexible working requirements.
How to apply

To apply please click on the 'Apply' button to complete your application.

No matter who you are, we encourage you to apply for the job that's right for you.

We are keen to increase diversity across our business, so our workforce reflects the diverse communities in which we work.
Our current focus is on employing more women at all levels of our organisation.
Benefits of working as a Data Analyst in Perth:
• Learning opportunities
• Advancement opportunities
• Competitive salary

About Us

Fortescue is both a proud West Australian company and a global green solutions business. We are recognised for our culture, innovation and industry-leading development of infrastructure, mining assets and green energy initiatives.

Our Opportunity

Work Location: Fortescue Centre & Bennett St
• Fortescue’s Perth office is located on the traditional lands of the Whadjuk Noongar people.

Roster: Monday to Friday

The Data Scientist is a critical role within the Data Analytics for Health and Safety team at Fortescue, responsible for leveraging data-driven insights to enhance health and safety initiatives. This role requires expertise in Python, machine learning, deployment in AWS using SageMaker, as well as proficiency in Snowflake and SQL for data access and analysis. Additionally, this role includes components of the Analytics Engineer role, such as automation using SQL/Snowflake and reporting using Power BI and Streamlit.

Key Responsibilities
• Utilize SQL and Snowflake to access, query, and analyze operational and safety data.
• Explore and clean data to identify trends and patterns relevant to health and safety objectives.
• Develop and implement machine learning and deep learning models to predict safety-related outcomes and support decision-making.
• Utilize Python libraries and frameworks for machine learning and deep learning tasks.
• Deploy machine learning models into production using AWS SageMaker, ensuring scalability and reliability.
• Monitor and maintain deployed models for optimal performance.
• Implement data automation solutions using SQL/Snowflake, including the development of stored procedures and tasks to streamline data workflows.
• Create data visualizations and reports using Power BI and Streamlit to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with the Visualization Engineer to enhance data storytelling.
• Collaborate with health and safety stakeholders to understand their data needs and align data science solutions with organizational objectives.
• Document data science methodologies, model development, and deployment processes.
• Share knowledge and best practices within the team.

Qualifications And Experience
• Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
• Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and deep learning.
• Experience with machine learning model development and evaluation.
• Proficiency in SQL and experience working with Snowflake for data access, analysis, and automation.
• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to derive actionable insights from complex data.
• (Beneficial) Deep learning expertise, including working with neural networks and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
• (Beneficial) Demonstrated experience with model deployment in AWS using SageMaker or in a cloud environment.
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
• A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.

Our Commitment

Fortescue is deeply committed to providing a safe culture that builds respect, fosters inclusiveness, and values diversity. We celebrate individual strengths and team members from all backgrounds are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. Our global workforce drives and promotes an inclusive culture, both within our organisation and throughout the communities we interact with across the world. Diverse backgrounds include First Nations Peoples, people with differing abilities, LGBTIQ+ community, gender, neurodiverse, cultural diversity, all age groups, and those with an intersectional or multiple diverse characteristics. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

https://fortescue.com/careers

Internal Candidates / Current Contractors please apply via Success Factors Careers Portal. For further information on how to apply please visit the Fortescue Hub.

Fortescue reserves the right to close applications early should a suitable pool of candidates be identified. Fortescue will never contact you to ask for payment of any kind, whether directly or through a third party.

• Hybrid working combining Perth office-based and work from home
• Supportive and inclusive workplace fostering strong collaboration
• Newly created role with significant business exposure

Want a better job?

You'll find it at Alinta Energy.

We're making energy better for our more than 1.1 million customers – and we're making work life better for our 1,000+ people too.

We believe in better
At Alinta Energy, we're a friendly bunch working to be the best energy company. Our culture is collaborative, and our passion drives positive change for people and the planet.

Over the past decade, we've evolved from a Western Australian residential gas retailer to one of Australia's largest energy retailers, generators, investors, and developers with infrastructure across Australia and New Zealand.

Help us make energy better

About the role:

Alinta Energy are looking for a collaborative Data Analyst to join their Trading & Portfolio Management team based in Perth. Specifically, you will be providing support to our customers as well as our business by transforming raw data into meaningful insights that contribute to future data and system enhancements.

In this permanent full-time role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams in providing assurance over financial data and ensuring alignment across systems and processes, through establishing frameworks, control reporting and regular risk-based testing and analysis.

In this role, you'll be:
• Supporting in the overall of scoping, planning, delivery of financial assurance
• Developing and executing control reporting, dashboards and other methodologies to easily assess the accuracy of systems and processes
• Proactively contribute to the continuous improvement of the function, highlighting opportunities to enhance ways of working, processes, and automation
• Developing a strong understanding of the operational systems, their interdependencies and operational use to ensure accuracy and compliance for the business and our customers
• Demonstrating daily personal behaviour that uphold Alinta Energy values.

Ideally, you'll bring to the role:
• A relevant tertiary qualification in Commerce, Data Science, Computer Science, or other relevant numeric discipline
• Experience in a data, assurance, or commercial role
• Working knowledge of SQL is essential and the ability to learn programming languages such as Python and R.
• Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
• A strong sense of collaboration and a passion for problem solving.

This is a fabulous role with great exposure to the business so understanding the importance of establishing strong business relationships will be paramount to your success.

Enjoy better benefits - check out our careers page for more information

One the best things about Alinta Energy is we discover better together. If you like the sound of that, and you're a match for the role, we'd love to talk to you.

Alinta Energy. That's better.

Alinta Energy is a 2023 Circle Back Initiative employer. We commit to respond to every applicant.

If you application progresses, we will need to complete background and pre-employment checks, such as immigration checks, reference checks, criminal background checks, qualification checks, and additional checks for roles related to finance.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Click 'Apply' to submit your application.
Closing date: 4 October 2023
LinkedIn#LI-KT1

About Our Client

Our client is a data consulting firm with offices in Australia, London and the USA, who work with a range of clients across utilities, resources, government and finance-sector clients.

You will be embedded with one of their utilities clients, working in parallel to a couple of other consultants in there (but also quite independently), as a key contributor to their data and analytics function.

You'll be supported with on-the-job training and have access to salary increases against your performance, as well as opportunity to move through formal training and certifications, in support of your success.

Job Description

You will be responsible for:
• Analysing business processes, collecting business requirements, assisting with specification of solutions.
• Sourcing, restructuring, manipulating, and modelling data to support decisions around clients' commercial issues.
• Supporting client understanding of analytical insight through creative presentation of data visualisations.
• Documenting implemented solutions and processes, providing guides and trainings for users.
• Ensuring all data management and processing is undertaken in adherence with internal policies.
• Building relationships within the business, working towards common objectives.

The Successful Applicant

To be considered for and successful in this role you will:
• Arrive with 2+ year's experience in a similar role, and be ready to expand your level of responsibility and autonomy
• Be able to demonstrate your commercial acumen, in delivering insights (not just analysis), to drive decision making within an organisation
• Ideally offer some programming experience in R or Python
• Be competent to build meaningful dashboards and reports that meet business requirements
• Offer good foundational skills in Excel, SQL, Power BI (including DAX)

What's on Offer

In return you will:
• Align with a data specific consulting firm, who will support your success in this role, and your ongoing development within the organisation more broadly
• Develop your skills in basic data engineering
• Pick up some experience in cloud technologies including Snowflake
• Get to access formal professional development opportunities
• Work in an autonomous role with a reasonable degree of responsibility / the ability to make your own decisions

The Data Analyst is an integral role within the SPS Division specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, KPIs and monthly reporting.

Our Company

Pacific Energy is one of Australia’s leading producers of sustainable distributed energy. We’ve been servicing remote townships, utilities and the mining industry for more than 40 years, delivering customised systems that integrate solar, wind, gas, diesel and battery storage systems.

Our dedicated team of experts and complete in-house capabilities mean we can deliver world-class projects from beginning to end, safely and on time.

We’re proud to be Australia’s largest remote power station builder and operator, with 48 sites nationally and more than 40% of our energy portfolio now powered by renewable and hybrid systems.

At Pacific Energy, we know the importance of a clean energy future. That’s why our organisation is driven by some of the industry’s finest engineers, electrical contractors, production specialists and project managers. Join us and help pave the way to a cleaner, brighter future.

Our Role

Our office in Perth is currently looking for a Data Analyst to work within the Service, Products and Stand-alone Power Systems Division, specializing in the analysis of contractual obligations, key performance indicators (KPIs), and monthly reporting on operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations.

This role will work closely with the Contract Manager and other internal stakeholders to provide actionable insights derived from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems data.

The Data Analyst will utilize tools such as Power BI, Power Query, and Excel to Export, Transform & Load (ETL) data into meaningful models and reports that drive business decisions for clients, managers, and teams.

Key Responsibilities

Position’s Duties Include But Are Not Limited To
• Contractual Analysis: Review and analyse contractual obligations and KPIs defined by the Contract Manager related to operational Renewable Energy assets and power stations.
• Monthly Reporting: Generate monthly reports focusing on the performance and status of energy systems designed, constructed, and/or owned by the Group.
• Data Integration: Assist in the analysis, reporting, and forecasting of data from financial, CRM, CMMS, and ERP systems.
• ETL Processes: Collaborate with internal subject matter experts to Export, Transform & Load data into useful data models and reports.
• Data Visualization: Utilize Power BI and Power Query to create compelling visualizations that communicate complex data in a straightforward manner.
• Stakeholder Communication: Present findings and insights to the Contract Manager, clients, and internal teams to inform and drive business decisions.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data by implementing and following best practices in data management.
• Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analytics tools and techniques.
• Responsible for compliance with OHS policies, ensuring workplace compliance, and reporting hazards and near misses.
• Foster a workforce culture of excellence, innovation, honesty and teamwork.
Selection Criteria:
• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, or related field.
• 1-2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the Renewable Energy sector.
• Proficiency in Power BI, Power Query, and MS Excel.
• Additional skills in Python, SQL, VBA, R, or similar languages would be advantageous.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
• Excellent communication and time management skills, conflict resolution abilities and confidence dealing with a wide range of people, from tradespeople to customers/stakeholders and supervisors.
• Understanding of OHSE requirements.
Additional benefits include:
• 9 Day fortnight (optional)
• Salary continuance insurance
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP), accessible to all employees and their families
• Retention bonus scheme
• Additional paid days off exceeding annual leave
• Employee referral program
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Pacific Energy, we celebrate the richness and depth that diversity brings. We know that it’s good for our people, our customers and the solutions that we bring to the table. That’s why we strongly encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations and gender identities to apply. We’re always learning, so please let us know what adjustments we can make to our recruiting processes to better support you.

For more information visit www.pacificenergy.com.au/ or follow Pacific Energy on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/company/pacific-energy-pty-ltd

One of our Global Client is hiring IT Data Analyst to join their fast-paced technology team.

PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organisations that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.

One of our Global Client is hiring IT Data Analyst to join their fast-paced technology team.

Your main duties and responsibilities will include:

We require a Technical Business Analyst for 3 months to assist with the following scope of work:

Migration to a new Workforce Planning Application

Timesheet data analytics and reporting

Workforce Planning Solution Migration

Determine if the proposed workforce planning application meets functional and performance requirements. If not, work with key stakeholders to select an appropriate tool.

Work with key stakeholders to identify and make changes to functions, data fields, and data model in the workforce planning tool to meet essential requirements.

Design data model and migrate from current spreadsheet into new workforce planning application

Conduct training sessions on how to use the new tool.

Timesheet Data Analysis & Reporting

Using data from our timesheet tool, design a set of timesheet reports that provide insight into:

Timesheet compliance

Timesheet booking accuracy

Hours planned vs actual per program/project/function variance report

Direct vs Indirect hours

Skills & Experience Required
• Systems Solution analysis and implementation experience

If interested in this role please apply today or alternatively send your resume to Neema Mehra, neema.mehra@persolkelly.com.au . Please note that due to the high volume of applicants only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Who are we

At PERSOLKELLY, our passion is - and always has been - putting you first.

We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.

We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.

We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.

So it's over to you. If you would like to join our team, please APPLY now.

To learn more about working with PERSOLKELLY, we encourage you to visit our website.

About the role

The Advisory Services Directorate is responsible for the high-level coordination and oversight of the Departments operational activities including policy and legislative reform, providing advice to government, building collaborative work arrangements within the Justice portfolio, public sector and broader community.

The Directorate assists with projects and investigations of strategic significance, business improvement initiatives and provides support and advice to the Director General on highly sensitive and confidential issues that impact on the whole of the Department.

The Principal Data Analyst is responsible for:
• Conducting and/ or overseeing the provision of data analysis to support the Director Generals office. Work collaboratively with other business areas to deliver outputs that align with the Department and Governments objectives.
• Monitoring quality and accuracy of statistical information ensuring consistency with the Department's strategic requirements.
• Represents the Legal Assistance Branch on internal or external committees, working parties and workshops as required.
• Supports the operations of the Legal Assistance Branch by assisting staff as required, including coaching and mentoring team members to develop and enhance their capabilities.

Eligibility

To be eligible for a permanent appointment to the Western Australian public sector it is essential that you are an Australian citizen or have permanent residency status in Australia. To be eligible for a fixed term appointment you must have documentary evidence of your entitlement to live and work in Australia for the duration of the contract.

All employees are required to undergo employment screening, which includes a National Criminal History Check and other checks that may be relevant to the position requirements.

About us

When you join the Department of Justice, you become part of a people-focused organisation, working hard to make our community a fairer and safer place to live. We offer many different employment opportunities in locations around Western Australia. You will have a chance to make a real difference to your local communities and to the lives of those you work with.

How to apply

Please ensure you review the attached JDF for further information about the requirements of the position. This information will assist you with the preparation of your application. For more information about the recruitment and selection process and other benefits, please refer to the Job Applicant Pack.

We require you to submit:
• A current comprehensive CV including the contact details of two referees and;
• A statement no more than 3 pages addressing all the Job Related Requirements and Role Specific Criteria contained in the JDF . Please provide examples to support your claims.

Please ensure you allow sufficient time to submit your application, as late applications will not be accepted.

To submit your application, click the " Apply for Job " button at the bottom of this page. Emailed applications will not be accepted.

Equity and Diversity

The Department of Justice is committed in building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of Aboriginal Australians, people with disability, youth, and other diversity groups. People with disability will be provided with reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.

Aboriginal job seekers may contact the Aboriginal Workforce Development Team on or call (08) 9264 1700 for culturally appropriate application advice.

Subsequent Vacancies

Applicants found suitable but not recommended for this vacancy, may be considered for subsequent similar vacancies in the Department of Justice for a period of twelve (12) months, in accordance with Part 5 (General Appointment) of the Commissioner's Instructions No. 2: Filling a Public Sector Vacancy and Commissioner's Instructions No. 39: Interim Arrangements to Fill Public Sector Vacancies.

data.job_title: Data Analyst – Data Team (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
data.job_description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Supply Equity Platform (SEP) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SEP team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including resource and product optimization. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce high quality results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SEP offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

In this Role, you’ll get to: 
• Manage complex analytics processes and algorithms to ensure their continued smooth operation, identifying root causes and debugging them where needed.
• Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organization.
• Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis).
• Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them.
• Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving resource and product optimization.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
• Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience.

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

What if your most rewarding experiences couldn’t be captured by a resume?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world. This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
• As this is an expressions of interest advertisement, please allow some delay in us getting back to your application*

What’s in it for you?

As a Data Engineer, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include:
• Be able to clearly explain data and analytics strengths and weaknesses to both technical and senior business stakeholders
• Responsible for developing batch ingestion and data transformation routines using ETL tools or other ingestion techniques
• Responsible for developing real-time ingestion and data transformation routines using Kafka and similar technologies
• Responsible for migrating data from legacy data platform to cloud data platform
• Present data in graphs, charts, tables, etc. and designing and developing relational databases for collecting data.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Configuration and coordination of data pipelines across projects
• Data pipeline development, including Azure Data Factory, AWS Kinesis and/or Spark
• Migration and transformation of large complex data sets from legacy systems like Teradata to cloud platform using Azure tools and other ETL tools like DataStage
• Data and Reporting Platform development on environments using technologies such as Microsoft Azure, SAP BW, Teradata, PowerBI or Cognos
• A strong background in coding with possible experience with Python, SAS, SQL and/or R
• Project delivery toolset experience in one or more batch ETL tools (such as DataStage, Informatica, Microsoft SSIS, Azure Data Factory or Talend) and/or open-source data integration tools (such as Kafka or Nifi)

What We Can Offer You
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
• Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

The minimum salary for this role is AUD $90,000 inclusive of 11% superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. • Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
• Good numerical reasoning skills
• Proficiency in Excel
• Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It’s Great if you Have:
• Experience in digital marketing
• Academic research experience

We have a client base that is the envy of our competitors covering most of Perth’s top companies.

Come and do something you love where you will be treated like part of the family!

What we offer

We are a nimble, low “red-tape”, highly professional but fun organisation. We pride ourselves on our expertise and being the type of people that want to help clients solve their problems.

Our Senior Business Analyst remuneration packages includes a great bonus scheme, additional holidays based on length of service, high spec laptop, phone allowances, plus free access to an on-site pool & gym.

Our bonus scheme means that the best analysts and consultants could earn significant amounts in addition to their base salary, which makes for an incredibly competitive package.

For the right candidate this could be a path to becoming your own boss with an ownership stake in the business.

Applications

To apply, please send your CV, covering letter (and samples of your work) to info@accessanalytic.com.au

For further enquiries, call Jeff Robson on +61 8 6210 8500.

Only those who are eligible to work in Australia already should apply (we cannot sponsor you, unfortunately). Applications from recruitment agents are not generally considered – your fees are too high!

Senior Business Analyst – Power BI

The Role

Are you passionate about Power BI, Excel, and the Power Platform? Come and make the most of your skills with a wide variety of projects using the technology you love all day, every day!

We are looking for highly professional, highly skilled and motivated individuals who would relish the challenge of providing reporting, data analytics, & reporting to a variety of world-class companies.

Reporting to the Directors, you will be involved directly in working on client consulting assignments, with responsibility for ensuring these are delivered on time, on budget, and in accordance with best practices.

You will have a lot of independence, flexibility, and autonomy. We do not micro-manage at Access Analytic.

Mandatory

A Power BI enthusiast.

Excellent understanding of Power Query (writing M), DAX, Power BI, data modelling, analytics, dashboard presentation.

Solid understanding of the Power BI service architecture – Workspaces, Apps, security.

5+ years’ practical experience (at least 2 years using Power BI) in reporting to internal stakeholders at all levels in the organisation, or experience in another related consultancy.

Bear in mind that this is a client-facing consulting role so we’re looking for more than just technical skills – you need to be comfortable talking to clients, calling them, attending client functions, and always dealing professionally with clients of all levels.

Confidence in providing the highest quality professional service to a wide client base. This role involves extensive client contact so highly-developed written and verbal English communication skills are essential. You also need to be comfortable with the idea of contacting clients, visiting them on your own, and managing your own time.

A friendly personality with the natural ability to form strong relationships with clients. We’re looking for people our clients will naturally love to work with time and time again!

A desire to develop yourself, learn and grow, plus the ability to handle multiple projects with conflicting demands at once.

Highly Desirable

DHL Global Forwarding (Australia) Pty Ltd is a global leader in the Freight Forwarding industry. We currently have a vacancy for a Senior Project Operations Specialist in our Industrial Projects Team based in our Perth office, WA.

About Us

Connecting People. Improving Lives.

DHL is the leading global brand in the logistics industry. Our DHL divisions offer an unrivalled portfolio of logistics services ranging from national and international parcel delivery, e-commerce shipping and fulfillment solutions, international express, road, air, and ocean transport to industrial supply chain management. With about 380,000 employees in more than 220 countries and territories worldwide, DHL connects people and businesses securely and reliably, enabling global sustainable trade flows. With specialized solutions for growth markets and industries including technology, life sciences and healthcare, engineering, manufacturing & energy, auto-mobility, and retail, DHL is decisively positioned as “The logistics company for the world”.

DHL is part of Deutsche Post DHL Group. The Group generated revenues of more than 81 billion euros in 2021. With sustainable business practices and a commitment to society and the environment, the Group makes a positive contribution to the world. Deutsche Post DHL Group aims to achieve net-zero emissions logistics by 2050.

Overall Role Purpose
• Provide customised freight forwarding solutions to meet or exceed customer requirements.
• Manage and support the execution of complex project shipments maintaining safety throughout.
• Maintenance and update of freight movement records on the Tracking System and with shipment record files.
• Liaise with carriers, sub-contractors and project clients in the coordination of freight movements.
• Strictly control the record keeping of cargo deliveries to the client at relevant handover points.
• Positively contribute in promoting safe and best practices with regards to HSE compliance within DGF Group, its Clients, Subcontractors and affiliates.
• Minimise risk exposure through careful planning of work activities, adherence to all internal and external procedures, and identification and reporting of hazards.
• Help the Project meet strict KPI deadlines without compromising safety standards.
• Work very closely with Project Manager and other key project team members to ensure project priorities are completed in a timely manner.
• Supervise all cargo handling requirements for the project. May be implanted in client’s depots and/or project site pending project requirement.
• Ensure cargo handling procedures are compliant with internal HSE processes, Operational procedures and industry best practice.
• Preparation of quotations for freight movements.
• Support and participate in Project Implementations in line company and client requirements.
• Support and participate in Project Tenders and RFQ’s
• Project invoicing and File Profitability Management – including financial reporting and invoice preparation and submission in line with company and client requirements.

Skills / Qualifications
• Tertiary qualified or an equivalent qualification
• At least (5) five years working experience in Project Operations, Logistics, Logistics Systems, or industry-related fields.
• Minimum three (3) to five (5) years of previous experience/knowledge of International Project Operations / Freight Forwarding / Account Management
• COR Certifications
• Wide ranging knowledge of Industrial Projects and/or the freight forwarding business, its

characteristics, competitors and likely future evolution.
• Experience handling Heavy Lift and Over Dimensional cargoes.
• Experience supervising sub-contractors.
• Strong Knowledge of Road Transport and Freight Forwarding procedures and regulations.
• Strong knowledge of cargo handling procedures and requirements.
• Strong knowledge of project over-dimensional and heavy lift cargo handling procedures.
• Strong operational management, risk management and business process skills.
• Strong HSE disciplines and adherence to DHL and Client compliance requirements.
• Strong problem-solving abilities.
• Strong consulting, persuasion, influencing and negotiation skills.
• The ability to make safe and responsible decisions yet meet project KPI’s and project deadlines.
• Organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and deliver time pressure and limited information/resources
• Sound administrative skills
• Results-driven and attention to details
• Able to work independently and coordinate account management requirements i.e. client visits
• A high degree of reliability and attention to detail
• Be a team player with a positive can-do attitude
• Be results driven and be able to demonstrate strong communication and administration skills
• Possess a high degree of attention to detail and a professional work ethic.

Why DHL Global Forwarding?

In a global business like ours, the opportunities are endless. So join us. Work with us. Grow with us. Stay with us. Discover the positive impact you can make and build an amazing DHL career.

We're one big team:
Our culture, our values, and the way we work together as a team, ensure that everyone feels valued and rewarded for the contribution they bring.

We grow together:
We've worked hard to create an environment where every individual can keep learning, keep growing, and enjoy a rewarding long-term career.

We do the right thing:
We understand the importance of contributing to society, reducing our environmental impact, and making a positive difference in the world.

Excellence. Simply Delivered.

Interested? … We would love to hear from you right away. APPLY NOW!

data.job_description:
• Do you like building visual representations of data?
• Do you enjoy exploring what value can be extracted from data?
• Do you like to innovate and problem solve?
• Do you have a curious analytical mind?

If your answer is “YES” to these questions, we are interested to talk to you!

What We Are Looking For

We are seeking a person who has a passion for all things data to join our team as a Data Analyst. In this position you will be responsible for assisting with the analysis, development and timely provision of Workforce related reports, data extracts and performance information for the North Metropolitan Health Service (NMHS).

Our team wants to transform data into insights that enable people to make decisions that have positive impacts on our people and patients. This role reports to the Principal Workforce Information Analyst.

This vacancy is for Permanent Full-Time and Permanent Part-Time appointment at various hours.

About Us

North Metropolitan Health Service covers almost 1000 square kilometres, with a population of almost 740,000, representing about 28 per cent of Western Australia’s total, and is projected to grow to more than 0.9 million by 2031. NMHS healthcare providers are fully accredited and offer a range of highly specialised, multidisciplinary, state-wide services from several hospital and outpatient/ambulatory care settings, as well as services specifically aimed at the north metropolitan catchment.

North Metropolitan Health Service (NMHS) fosters an environment of equity and inclusion and strives to ensure everyone experiences a sense of belonging. We celebrate the rich diversity of our community and are committed to recruiting a team that is reflective of those we care for. We encourage anyone who aligns with our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, innovation and care to apply for this role.

NMHS is committed to growing the Aboriginal workforce as a part of our Aboriginal Health and Wellbeing Strategy. As a measure to achieve equality, Section 51 of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 applies to this position.

NMHS upholds the social model of disability. If you have any access needs or require adjustments to participate in the recruitment process, please contact Justin Lenhoff on 0402 670 645 or email justin.lenhoff@health.wa.gov.au .

While your qualifications and experience tell us part of your story, your values and attitude speak louder still. At NMHS, we aim to ensure our behaviours reflect our core values: Care, Respect, Innovation, Teamwork & Integrity. During the selection process you will be assessed on your ability to fulfil the responsibilities of this position while upholding our values.

What We Offer

In addition to the great salary our employees enjoy an amazing range of benefits
• Generous salary packaging
• Diverse and inclusive culture
• A smoke free environment
• Flexible leave arrangements
• Professional development opportunities
• Paid study leave
• Flexible working arrangements
• Continuous learning
• Professional and location-based allowances

NMHS supports flexible working practices and consideration will be given to flexible work options, where operationally appropriate.

Want to know more about this role?

We encourage you to contact Justin Lenhoff on 0402 670 645.

We think you’ll like it here

Our employees like working here, and we think you will too. Watch this video to find out what they have to say.

Ready to join our team?

Applicants are required to apply online so allow enough time to complete the online application process and attach your documentation. If you experience difficulties, please contact Employee Services on 13 44 77 for immediate assistance during business hours.

Your Application Should Include
• A statement in no more than 3 pages addressing the selection criteria as outlined in the attached JDF.
• A comprehensive CV that clearly shows your experience relevant to this role; and
• The names and contact details of two (2) professional referees. It is preferable for one of your referees to be your current supervisor or manager.

Eligibility to Apply: Australian citizenship or permanent residency is an essential requirement for applicants to be considered for permanent positions in the public sector. To be eligible for a fixed term appointment you must have documentary evidence of your entitlement to live and work in Australia for the period of the contract.

Whilst this selection process will initially be used to fill the above vacancy, it may also be used to fill other "similar" vacancies throughout the health service. In addition to this, should the successful applicant decline or vacate the advertised vacancy, then the next most suitable applicant may also be selected from this process. Both of these options remain valid for a period of twelve (12) months from when the authorised delegate endorses the recruitment decision.

Lodgement is system generated. Any submissions after or on, 4:00pm on the closing date will not be accepted.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Full Job Description
3 months contract working on Spatial Analytics for a well-known Utilities entity in WA

Your new company

You will be working for a well-known utilities entity in WA within their Data & Analytics team which provides geospatial information and solutions to various business needs.

Your new role

Responsible for developing and delivering geographical information systems (GIS) mapping and visualisation data products and solutions at all levels of the business.
Provide technical support and services in mapping and visualisation in a spatial environment to achieve required business outcomes.
Collaborate with the business to understand customer requirements and apply GIS best practice standards and tools.

What you’ll need to succeed

A degree level qualification in Geographical Information Science, Geography, Environmental Science or related discipline, and considerable experience in and knowledge of geospatial information analysis techniques and applications (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, GE Smallworld, FME, CAD, ERDAS Imagine, FME, python).
Knowledge of geographic information systems and geospatial data management, as well as relevant knowledge of static and web mapping, cartography and 3D visualisation within a GIS platform.
Have well-developed interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, good analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to work in a team environment.

What you’ll get in return

Opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects that involve geospatial data analysis and visualisation.
Work with a supportive and collaborative team that values your contribution and expertise.
Enjoy competitive rates, as well as opportunities for professional development and career growth.

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to Lakita.Tarachandani@hays.com.au, or for more information and a confidential discussion, please call us on 08 9254 4551.

VGW is a fast-growing technology company and creator of market-leading online social games. With offices across Australia, USA, Canada, Malta and the Philippines we are on a mission to be the biggest gaming company in the world!

We have a brand new role for a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team.

As the BI Analyst you will support the BI team's ability to be proactive by leading the creation of data assets to be used as building blocks for our newly developed framework and promoting the BI team's policies and procedures across the organisation.

Note: This is a hybrid role to based in either our Sydney or Perth office location.

Key responsibilities will include:
• Support the creation of the new target state framework and governance for end-to-end reporting, tooling integration and self-service BI products
• Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy by updating and classifying terms and metrics
• Create new reports and retrofit existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI-related products to the new state
• Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW’s Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
• Create supporting documentation that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across VGW
• Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework and governance
• Work closely with business users to understand their data and reporting needs
• Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
• Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW’s Data Catalog and BI’s new processes and procedures

What you will bring to the role:
• A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
• 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
• Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
• Business acumen
• Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
• Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

About VGW

VGW has been disrupting the online gaming world since 2010 and we're only getting started. We've assembled an incredibly talented global team who bring their passion, energy and expertise to build games that people love.

At VGW, we have a modern approach to getting work done and a focus on creating an environment where amazing people can do amazing work. That means giving you the flexibility you need, providing spaces that will keep you comfortable and finding opportunities for you to keep learning and growing.

Find out more at www.vgw.co

If you want to join a team that does things differently apply today and we look forward to seeing what you can bring to our team.

Why VGW?

We are on a huge mission to become the biggest gaming company in the world. As we grow to meet this goal, we need talented people rich in diversity to propel us forward. We truly believe the right mix of diversity and authenticity will be our winning hand.

We are committed to creating a diverse, engaging and inclusive culture for our people to shine, with a workplace that honours your experiences, perspectives, unique identity and passions. For those reasons, we encourage you to browse our employment opportunities and apply today. Please let us know of any accommodations you may need during the application process.

Junior Technical Analyst roles often involve high-profile projects in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and gaining first-hand exposure to business operations. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.

About This Role

If you are eager to take on a challenge and use your logical problem-solving skills to make an impact in the world of technology, then this is the role for you! Our program is designed to equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to start and grow a successful career.

As a Technical Analyst, you will have the opportunity to apply your skills to innovative projects and make a real impact in a variety of sectors. You will be responsible for investigating and developing solutions for applications. It could be robotic process automation, quality assurance and IT infrastructure delivery for global businesses.

What will my time at FDM be like

Your journey will begin with training out of FDM’s award-winning academy. While interviews and assessments are done remotely, you now have the option to undertake training online or at our centrally located, 21st floor Sydney office in Barangaroo.

The 10-week industry specific training covers high-demand skills such as SQL, Unix; Excel/VBA, BA, Python, ITIL, Cloud and OS-Admin with the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout.

After successfully completing your training, you’ll step into an integral position with one or more of our industry-leading, multinational clients in Australia.

What we offer you:
• A full-time employment contract with job security
• Opportunities to work across Australia with relocation support where appropriate
• Training is provided by industry experts, covering both technical and professional skills to ensure you are job-ready
• Ongoing career support throughout your entire FDM journey, including professional development, mentoring, and social networking events with a community of peers
• A chance to launch a career in one of the most in-demand tech fields

We ask you have the following:
• Educated to a university degree level (bachelor or higher), no STEM degree required
• Demonstrable interest and desire to work in technology
• Ability to commit to completing our full 2.5-year graduate program
• Ability to relocate to Sydney or Melbourne to support our clients. (Relocation package will be provided)
• Eligible to work in Australia (Australian citizen or permanent resident)

There has never been a better time to start a career in tech – Apply Now!

About FDM

Our people are our passion. That's why we make your training and career growth our priority. We are a global professional services provider, focusing on IT. We are also one of the Australia's leading graduate employers, recruiting the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. With centres across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific, and over 5,000 consultants placed on client site globally, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

data.job_title: Expressions of Interest - Data Modeller | Data and Analytics
data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

What if we didn’t focus on who you are now, but who you could become?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.

This role is open to applicants across Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.

What’s in it for you?

As a Data Modeller, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include:
• Lead, develop and maintain data taxonomies, data models, schemas and definitions across all lines of business while working closely with Data Architects and various system stakeholders
• Advise and implement leading industry practice data modelling production, storage, and consumption standards, elaborate and champion best practices for data modelling and evolving practices like schema driven development, schema DevOps and modern data modelling techniques
• Build and maintain strong relationships with our key architects and stakeholders across clients and internal EY service lines
• Understand and document how data is, or will be used, and its implications on people, processes, products and technology
• Contribute and evolve EY’s data modelling frameworks, standards and best practices

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Data modelling using techniques such as Schema driven modelling, Data Vault, 3rd Normal Form, Kimball (5+ Years)
• Broad domain experience including Financial Services (Banking, Insurance), Defence, Health and Logistics, with the ability to link the dots across industry data sets
• Understanding of traditional Data Modelling principles (Kimball, 3NF, Data Vault, etc.)
• Ability to translate business requirements to technical requirements from Conceptual to physical data models
• Ability to translate high level design into specific implementation steps

What We Can Offer You
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
• Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
• Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000AUD including 11% superannuation.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond.
• Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months.
